title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For correctly drawing and labeling the weight and normal force at point A

1 point is earned: For correctly drawing and labeling the weight and normal force at point B

1 point is earned: For correctly drawing and labeling the frictional force at point A

Note: A maximum of 2 points can be earned if there are any extraneous vectors.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Correct answer: “Increase”

1 point is earned: For a statement indicating the rotational inertia of the hoop is greater

1 point is earned: For a statement indicating the effect of the greater rotational inertia on the linear speed of the hoop

Example: Since the rotational inertia of the hoop is higher than that of the sphere, if the hoop and sphere start at the same height, the hoop will rotate at a slower speed and thus have a lower linear speed. Therefore, you need to start it at a higher initial height so that it travels fast enough to make it through the loop.
